policies.name: Health Plan Coverage Verification
policies.description: Guidelines for verifying coverage eligibility and plan benefits before claim processing.

criteria.condition: Member has active coverage on date of service
criteria.action: Proceed with claim processing
criteria.rationale: Coverage must be active on DOS to process claim

criteria.condition: Service falls within plan benefit categories
criteria.action: Apply appropriate cost-sharing based on plan type
criteria.rationale: HMO, PPO, EPO, POS plans have different benefit structures

criteria.condition: Provider is in-network for HMO plans
criteria.action: Process at in-network rates
criteria.rationale: HMO plans require in-network providers except emergencies

modifying_factors.impact: In-network rates apply regardless of provider network status
Claim eligible for standard processing
May require adjustment based on primary payer

policies.name: Deductible Application Rules
policies.description: Rules for applying individual and family deductibles to claims.

criteria.action: Apply eligible charges to deductible before coinsurance
criteria.rationale: Deductible must be satisfied before plan pays coinsurance

criteria.condition: Family deductible met but individual not met
criteria.action: Waive remaining individual deductible for embedded plans
criteria.rationale: Embedded family deductibles protect individual members

criteria.action: Cover at 100% without deductible
criteria.rationale: ACA-compliant preventive care exempt from cost sharing

modifying_factors.impact: Deductible accumulation resets to zero
Pro-rated deductible may apply
Separate deductible for accident-related claims

policies.name: Copayment Collection Rules
policies.description: Guidelines for applying copayments based on service type and provider.

criteria.action: Apply PCP copay amount per plan schedule
criteria.rationale: Primary care visits have lower copays to encourage preventive care

criteria.action: Apply specialist copay amount per plan schedule
criteria.rationale: Specialist copays are higher to manage utilization

criteria.action: Apply ER copay; waive if admitted within 24 hours
criteria.rationale: ER copay waiver for admissions prevents double cost-sharing

criteria.action: Apply urgent care copay per plan schedule
criteria.rationale: Urgent care copays encourage appropriate care setting

modifying_factors.impact: Higher copay or coinsurance applies
May have reduced or waived copay
Standard copay applies

policies.name: Out-of-Pocket Maximum Rules
policies.description: Rules for tracking and applying out-of-pocket maximums.

criteria.action: Pay 100% of covered services for remainder of plan year
criteria.rationale: OOP max protects members from catastrophic costs

criteria.action: Pay 100% for all family members for remainder of plan year
criteria.rationale: Family OOP max provides household-level protection

criteria.condition: Service not subject to OOP accumulation
criteria.action: Process normally; do not count toward OOP max
criteria.rationale: Some services excluded from OOP accumulation per plan terms

modifying_factors.impact: Separate OOP accumulators may apply
Federal limits on maximum OOP for essential benefits
Must meet minimum deductible before plan pays

policies.name: Network Status Determination
policies.description: Rules for determining provider network status and applicable rates.

criteria.condition: Provider in contracted network on date of service
criteria.action: Apply in-network rates and cost sharing
criteria.rationale: Contracted rates ensure member protection from balance billing

criteria.action: Deny claim unless emergency or authorized referral
criteria.rationale: HMO plans require network utilization except emergencies

criteria.action: Apply out-of-network cost sharing; member responsible for balance
criteria.rationale: PPO allows OON access with higher member cost sharing

criteria.action: Apply in-network cost sharing for OON emergency/ancillary services
criteria.rationale: NSA protects patients from surprise medical bills

modifying_factors.impact: Continuity of care provisions may apply
OON may be covered if no network provider available
Special network arrangements for complex care

policies.name: Prior Authorization Requirements
policies.description: Guidelines for services requiring prior authorization.

criteria.condition: Service on prior auth required list without authorization
criteria.action: Pend claim; request clinical documentation
criteria.rationale: Prior auth ensures medical necessity before expensive services

criteria.action: Process claim per authorization terms
criteria.rationale: Pre-approved services should process without additional review

criteria.action: Process claim; conduct retrospective review within 48 hours
criteria.rationale: Emergency services cannot wait for prior auth

modifying_factors.impact: 24-hour turnaround required
May have reduced auth requirements
Continued stay auth may be needed

policies.name: Coordination of Benefits Rules
policies.description: Rules for coordinating payment when member has multiple coverage.

criteria.action: Process claim applying standard benefits and cost sharing
criteria.rationale: Primary plan pays first based on COB rules

criteria.action: Pay up to plan allowance minus primary payment and patient responsibility
criteria.rationale: Secondary plan coordinates to prevent overpayment

criteria.condition: Birthday rule applies for dependent children
criteria.action: Parent with earlier birthday month/day is primary
criteria.rationale: Industry standard for determining primary coverage for dependents

modifying_factors.impact: Special MSP rules apply
WC is always primary for work injuries
PIP/MedPay primary for auto accidents

policies.name: Fee Schedule Application
policies.description: Rules for applying contracted fee schedules to claims.

criteria.action: Pay contracted rate less member cost sharing
criteria.rationale: Contracted rates ensure predictable costs for all parties

criteria.condition: Procedure code not in fee schedule
criteria.action: Apply usual and customary or Medicare-based rate
criteria.rationale: Non-contracted codes priced using reference rates

criteria.condition: Billed amount less than fee schedule
criteria.action: Pay billed amount as maximum
criteria.rationale: Never pay more than provider charges

modifying_factors.impact: Secondary procedures paid at reduced rate
Reduced payment for surgical assistance
May have bundled or reduced payment

policies.name: Plan Exclusion Determination
policies.description: Guidelines for identifying and processing excluded services.

criteria.action: Deny claim with cosmetic exclusion code
criteria.rationale: Cosmetic procedures not medically necessary

criteria.action: Deny unless approved under clinical trial exception
criteria.rationale: Experimental treatments require special approval process

criteria.condition: Service not covered under plan benefits
criteria.action: Deny with benefit exclusion code; member responsible
criteria.rationale: Non-covered services are member's financial responsibility

modifying_factors.impact: Reconstructive after illness/injury may be covered
FDA-approved uses may convert experimental to covered
Some exclusions overridden by state law

policies.name: Timely Filing Requirements
policies.description: Rules for claim submission deadlines and exceptions.

criteria.condition: Claim submitted within filing deadline (typically 90-180 days)
criteria.action: Accept claim for processing
criteria.rationale: Timely filing limits ensure accurate and efficient processing

criteria.condition: Claim submitted after deadline without valid exception
criteria.action: Deny claim with timely filing denial code
criteria.rationale: Late claims impact administrative efficiency

criteria.action: Allow extended filing period from discovery date
criteria.rationale: COB claims may have delayed filing rights

modifying_factors.impact: Different filing limits may apply
Original timely filing date preserved
Filing period may start from eligibility confirmation
